author: Sachin Patel
text: 'The Rose Chai here is amazing
column5: why buy the ingredients when these guys have perfected it!'

author: Gaurang Patel
text: 'I have been a customer here for years
column5: you cannot be the quality of product here.'

author: shar s
text: "The ambience was pretty cool and ethnic. We ordered a couple of items from their 'Most popular' menu . Rose chai
column5: bombay sandwich and avacado toast were amazing. A good place to visit again!"

author: Gina Bucchiano
text: 'Great coffee!'

author: Jason Ganz
text: 'This place has excellent coffee. You get to pick the flavor of coffee you want for a pour over.  In addition
column5: everything is done by cup
column6: any not mass made in a bit machine
column7: your cup therefore is fresh.  However
column8: the bagel I got was overcooked
column9: and was hard and chewy rather than soft.  If a bagel can be made soft but not insipid
column10: that would be the perfect bagel to have with a morning cup of coffee.\n\nI am happy that it is a female owned business and will continue to support them. Just work on the bagels and the review will become five stars.'

author: Anuj Mittal
text: 'Finally a place with nice Indian style teas'

author: Ravi Teja Kolla
text: 'Great ambiance and good taste.'

author: Katrina Michalewski
text: "The coffee here is absolutely delicious. Haven't eaten here yet
column5: but its a great vibe."

author: Lakshmi Maddali
text: 'Love their rose chai and donuts. This place is a hidden gem (no pun intended).'

author: EMAN ALOFI
text: 'I really like their Rose Chai Latte
column5: and the variety of options that they do have .. üëç'

author: Ian Fette
text: 'I love the Garden St location
column5: but this location (by PATH) is chronically understaffed in the morning. I waited over 15 minutes for a latte *after* placing my order today. I don‚Äôt have that kind of time built into my morning commute.'

author: Paige DiFiore
text: 'Love the honey bee latte! It‚Äôs so spacious in here and very photogenic
column5: too.'

author: Haotian Cai

author: Rishi Takrani
text: 'Great experience

column6: it tasted amazing. Nice ambience to sit
column7: relax and enjoy a cup of tea/coffee with friends. Do check it out
column8: variety of options available for everyone. Also they have vegan and gluten free desserts available at Hoboken store'

author: Randall Blecher
text: 'A refreshingly different coffee shop with a great selection of coffee and chai drinks.  The donuts are delicious too.'

author: Simon Gorelkin
text: 'Monica is the best!'

author: X Boone (The FiG)
text: 'De-LISH ! cheesiest BeC in the area'

author: Dheeraj Chakilam
text: 'Vegan filter coffee with oatly oat milk is amazing!\n\nThe vegan traditional chais (spiced or sweet) are great as well!'

author: Tushar Sudake
text: 'Slow service.\nNot tasty.'

author: Jennifer Krems
text: 'Great decor and cozy. One of the best chais around!'

author: Christabelle Liu
text: "Loved this place when it was Simply Chai
column5: and still love it now! Though I miss some of their DELICIOUS egg/toast/hot sauce dishes
column6:
the Bombay Sandwich is SO GOOD!

I'm also a big fan of their hot Saffron Chai and hot Rose Chai!

The actual coffeeshop is so spacious and comfortable
column7: and so well decorated as well. Things are appropriate spaced out
column8: and I usually see the same girl behind the counter when I go (average height
column12: usually in 2 braids??). Sorry I don't know your name but you're so friendly and quick

author: Katie Mc Croy
text: 'Came to try their donuts that they post on IG
column5: they were all super small compared to the zoomed in pictures on IG. Then
column6: they were all stale and super dense
column7: not flakey or soft like a donut should be...maybe cause they were stale?\n\nBiggest turn off was that we posted about it on Instagram and they deleted my comment and didn‚Äôt even bother DM-ing me; this alone tells me I will never bring business to them again. We own a business and I understand the customer is not always right but be transparent and honest
column8: don‚Äôt just delete negative reviews smh'

author: Nivesh Kalra
text: 'The service is crazy slow ..there were two people in the kitchen and only one person was serving orders ... Given the number of orders I would have thought the second person would jump in to serve too. However the food is actually pretty good.'

author: Ananya Gupta
text: "Looks like Simply Chai has been renamed to Hidden Ground Coffee; I'm assuming the tea went selling by itself.\n\nI ordered the ginger tea and elaichi/cardamom tea. While the former was okay (not strong enough in the ginger flavor) the latter was okay and too mild to the point of being off. There were also a lot of residual strands which should have been filtered out."

author: Shreya Mukherjee
text: 'I‚Äôve order ginger tea couple of times from the Hoboken store. It‚Äôs either a hit or miss depending on who‚Äôs making it. And a very expensive tea for around 6$. Also they‚Äôve replaced the sandwiches with ‚Äúnaan‚Äùwiches I don‚Äôt know why !! The sandwiches were good ... but seeing the bread being replaced by naan
column5: don‚Äôt feel like trying again !'

author: Ashni D
text: 'I went to the Simply Chai in New Brunswick for the first time a couple of months ago (September 2020) and had a terrible experience. There was a male staff who was very rude to me and my family. The guy was unwelcoming
column5: impatient
column6:
and spoke very aggressively to us when we were placing our order. We had some difficulty hearing him speak while he was wearing his mask and he got annoyed at us for having to repeat what he said. I have never experienced such terrible customer service at any other place. It made us feel very sad to be treated this way.

We ordered 4 hot chai drinks and they were all lukewarm and did not even taste like chai. It was lukewarm milk with some syrup in it. The small cups were only 3/4 full and for such an expensive place I would have expected at least a full cup of "authentic chai".

I came back again last week hoping for a better experience
column7: especially because I was a regular at Hidden Grounds. However
column8: everything I mentioned above holds true - the same staff member was rude again and there was no improvement in the quality of the drinks
column9: which is why I felt the need to write this review. I will not be coming back again.'

author: Michael Samaniego
text: 'I love their donuts - Have probably ordered more than a dozen of them but don‚Äôt regret it one bit!\n\nMy favorite is the Rose Lemon Donut - It‚Äôs fluffy
column5:
not too sweet and just melts in my mouth

Will keep ordering!

I don‚Äôt understand all you one star reviewers.'

author: Sourabh Saha
text: 'Wonderful chai! Especially the masala chai.\nThe Bombay grill cheese is also worth trying üíØ'

author: anwar hyder
text: 'I wish I could give a zero. Horrible chai from the place which has the word chai in their name. Expensive and tasteless sugar water. Not sure how this place has many high reviews. Please contact me and I can share a recipe for a better chai. Good luck and take care !'

author: Chirag Rana
text: 'Weekdays are lame! Not a happening spot. Must visit in weekends. Overpriced for a tea lol\nStarbucks üëå'

author: Jacalyn Boer
text: 'A really cute spot with delicious drinks.'

author: Shree Rodriguez
text: "Taking traditional Indian sweets and turning those flavors into donuts/bundt cakes..... Pure genius! Their chai
column5: sandwiches
column6: and bakery items are so delicious!! If you haven't visited yet
column7: you are missing out!!"

author: Tatiana Super
text: 'Good food and doughnuts and amazing rose chai latte!!!'

author: Jin Park
text: 'Three words: spicy grilled cheese.\n\nWow. Hearty sando packs a punch. I‚Äôll be back for more + cardamom tea.'

author: Nuha Syed
text: 'I drove about an hour to get some chai because I was excited to try out Simply Chai
column5: but I was extremely disappointed with the customer service. I am not sure if the drinks are worth the customer service!'

author: Akshay Arora
text: 'This was a nice find. Very cozy
column5: desi and cool Indian food and drinks. The Saffron Chai Latte was yumm and the Hot Chai my friend had was also delicious!! Highly recommended.. üåü'

author: Sravani Giddaluri
text: 'My go to chai place'

author: Priyank. A
text: 'Worth visiting! The masala chai and bombay sandwich were great.'

author: Kritika Singh
text: 'An amazing place to hangout with friends and sip a cup of chai. Variety of fusion and traditional chai options. Their signature gulab Jamun donuts and rasmalai donuts are to die for. One of the amazing indian fusion places in Hoboken. Their menu is very interesting and they keep adding new stuffs to their menu. The best part of the place was dosa waffles which they have discontinued due to covid hope to get it back soon on menu!üòÄ'

author: thahmeena begum
text: '(Ice gola) kala khatta and kacchi kairi was worst full of condensed milk you can‚Äôt even hold in you mouth toooo mucchh sweet'

author: Dini Ajmani
text: 'On three different occasions I have tried to order a speciality drink and the barista messed it completely. The staff is untrained. Today
column5: for my mango lassi
column6: the guy started reading the instructions for the first time. Took a long time to make it and The drink was extremely sweet. Given how expensive their drinks are
column7: it was such a disappointment. The place is a great idea executed poorly.'

author: Maulik Jajal
text: 'Nice place for fresh Masala/Ginger Tea and tasty  Sandwich near Hoboken terminal.'

author: Prachee K
text: "Went in to grab a drink late one Sunday afternoon. There was no crowd so we were able to walk right in and order. We got a hot saffron chai latte to-go. They did have outdoor seating available but we decided to stroll the nearby waterfront instead. The saffron and chai flavors worked really well together. They offer some very interesting tea combinations. Seems like they have a really creative brunch menu too. I would definitely like to try more of their items next time I'm in the area."

author: Archie VS
text: 'Great egg sandwich. Very tasty. Their gulab jamun donut is a must have. Will definitely go back to try some of their Chai varieties. The menu makes the place seem like a fast food place but it does take a bit of time for them to get your order ready especially on a busy day. Patience and mask requires üòâ'

author: amandeep singh
text: 'Good place to hang out for tea'

author: D Saxena
text: 'The food here is amazing. I‚Äôve been twice and had the cupcakes
column5: donuts
column6: veggie samosa
column7: one of the chai drinks and kala Katta. All items were phenomenal. I don‚Äôt know what other reviewers are comparing the gulab jamun donut and ras malai cupcake to. I‚Äôve never had anything like these items
column9: the flavor is so strong on all items and comes through. The ras malai cupcake tastes like ras malai
column10: the rose cupcake tastes like a rose falooda. Even the veggie samosa
column11: though the frozen taste was there
column12: it was still so nicely flavored that I didn‚Äôt care. Coming from downtown jersey city I know what bad cupcakes are and these are fluffy sweet and tasty. No they‚Äôre not magnolia or Carlos but we don‚Äôt need another vanilla cupcake. I will be back every chance I get. 4 stars is for the awful service. Please hire more and better people. It takes way too long for a basic order and the service is rude and unfriendly on top of it both times I have been. Sometimes slow service can be made up for by a warm smile and nice attitude
column13: and this place doesn‚Äôt have it. But tone is set at the top so I would look for management to change this.'

author: Bri
text: 'I recently came here to try something different and enjoyed the drinks
column5: though they are a bit on the pricier side. I love that they offer gluten free donuts
column6: and had the lemon poppyseed. My boyfriend had a mango lassi and said the flavor was good
column7: but would‚Äôve preferred it to be a bit colder (this could just be that we‚Äôre not used to how it should be prepared). I noticed a lot of reviews that had issues with the staff
column8: but had a pleasant experience when we were there.'

author: Mehul Mistry
text: "Chai was way too expensive. Ordered ginger tea but it was okayish
column5: didn't taste like authentically brewed chai. Also ordered Bombay sandwich which was ok."

author: Kelly Patel
text: 'Started following on Instagram and was really looking forward to my visit. I ordered a iced saffron chai tea latte which was disappointing. Only taste of milk and sugar came through. No saffron. I also ordered rose cupcake
column5: ras malai cupcake
column6: chai masala donut and gulab jamun donut. First of all the donuts where just cake mixes shaped in a round
column7: not a donut
column8: really dense and lacking in strong flavor. The cupcakes were GOD awful. Stale
column9: unappetizing and the cream frosting was dense
column11: and tasted like thick cement. They need to do some quality control on their drinks and desserts. A place like this is an amazing concept and could do so much to advance strong Indian flavors but today‚Äôs selection was a miss. I wouldn‚Äôt go back unless they change. One star only for supporting a homegrown business and maintaining business during a pandemic.'

author: Aditi Gupta
text: "We ordered signature golaganda (crushed ice that costs more than $7 at this place after taxes) and all we got was rose flavored icy milk. This was supposed to have three flavors. Maybe they should tell people if they are out of 2 of the 3 flavors. I was so excited to try my favorite childhood dessert and was sorely disappointed. Who adds milk to gola?? Ridiculous.\n\nEdited to respond to the owner response: We were the only ones there when we ordered
column5: and the server called us specifically to give this order to us on a table close to us (we didn't pick up the order from the counter). No one else came in or left during this time. Maybe you need to train your staff to prepare the correct order. We live 40 minutes away so can't just hop in again. Thanks for the response though."

author: Raj Asokkumar
text: 'To the Owner- Please teach some basic customer service to the person who is taking the order. I walked in to your place at 2:30PM- Aug 30th. The person taking the order said I may order the food through her or through the tablet. So we decided to order the food through the tablet. In the middle of the ordering process
column5: the tablet timed out and deleted our cart before placing the order. So we walked up to her to place the order through her but she refused to take our order claiming that she was busy. When I went back to the tablet there was already someone placing the order and they took almost 10 mins to complete their order. When I asked her to bump our order because we were there before she refused and gave us a irresponsible reply to us. She simply said sorry with a horrible attitude but refuse to take out order. This place is really slow and if you are short of staff
column6: hire an extra person. I saw 2 people walked out without placing the order  because this place is order. Please teach some basic customer service to your employees and tell them to apologize when they mean it or have a solution. You lost my business!'

author: Vineeth Nair
text: 'The staff wasn‚Äôt wearing gloves while preparing and asked for tips; Ordered rose chai latte: very sweet . Not satisfied!'

author: ABHIJEET TAWAR
text: 'Really nice place for brunch'

author: Sameer Misra
text: 'We went there again on August 1 around 8:40-ish in the evening. We were really hungry and placed an order for two sandwiches
column5: one chai and one soda. There were two orders before me and the service was really slow. About 20-25 minutes after placing the order
column6: they informed me that they stop preparing sandwiches 15 minutes before closing. I wish they informed me earlier or if there was a simple notice saying the same thing in the store then I wouldn‚Äôt have wasted 25 mins standing waiting for my order. The chai was disappointing for 5 bucks
column7: which is more than Starbucks
column8:
and so was the Kala Khatta soda.
I was there in early January as well when the menu had dosa waffles. The food was good back then but the service was slow and disappointing.

Editing after owner‚Äôs response since there is no option for reply:
At least the staff should have a glance at the orders coming in and let people know they won‚Äôt be served food instead of making them wait for 20 mins before informing.
Why I called the chai disappointing?
It wasn‚Äôt good
column9: I didn‚Äôt like it. When we pay $5 for a coffee or chai whether at Starbucks
column11: a local chai shop or any other place.. we expect it to be good :)'

author: Sushobhita singh
text: 'Such a beautiful ambience! Perfect fusion cafe...I had mango cup cakes and Green Mango soda drink. Both the items were yummy üòã Definitely reccomend this place.'

author: Jayeeta Putatunda
text: 'Horribly slow service. Staff should be a little more courteous.'

author: abhishek jain
text: 'Horrible service looong wait and still got wrong order. When reported to the cashier
column5: she started arguing and said that she cant fix and had to call the manager\nDrinks were good but food items were horrible\nWorst service ever!'

author: Sachin Jain
text: 'horrible horrible service.. extremely impolite and rude staff..\n\nThey serve wrong orders and refuse to correct..'

author: Dixie Mortals
text: 'I enjoy how simply chai is a chill environment with unique Indian/ Hindu (not sure the accuracy on that) style decor and options. I recommend this place even if your just stoping by. It is toward the pricy side but its quality worth.\n\nMy go to is Alex since the start. There‚Äôs a new girl that works there she is my other go to. Not sure what her name is
column5: it start Ed something.'

author: Fatima Dastagir
text: 'This is the best place to fulfill all your chai cravings!! ALEX is my go to person and all time fav also!!! 100% RECOMMENDED üòä'

Some snacks are overpriced like the above 2 but it is a must try when you visit this cafe. The falooda I tried in the end doesn‚Äôt live upto the expectation since it was full of ice and essence'

author: Anuja Shah
text: 'In love with their drinks n dosa waffles'

author: Jared Johnson (Jared)
text: 'The flavors are there
column5: but nothing is so authentic nor elevated to justify the inflated prices
column6: especially for the baked goods.'

author: Deepak Shah
text: 'Loved it'

author: Lisa Proctor
text: 'Been to this Cafe many times. They have really great Teas. My Boyfriend
column5: his friends
column6:
and me usually order the Magic Masala Chai and the Cardamom Chai.

I recently ordered from Simply Chai through Grubhub delivery. Our teas smelled sour and made our tummies hurt a little.

Not sure if it was just an off day or maybe something happened during transit with Grubhub.

We will still be back as this seems like a one off situation.

Thanks'

author: Yashas Bysani Muralidhar
text: 'Amazing place. Love the mild flavored chai.'

author: Sonia Malhotra
text: 'Great fare and ambience however they always seem to close down earlier than the usual time. Happened once when I was there with a friend
column5: we were told on entering that the place is shutting down at 6
column6: when the usual time is 8 pm; we finished in a hurry and left.  Second time
column7: called them beforehand and same response. It will be good if the website and the auto response on the phone number can be updated to reflect actual timings.'

author: Ginette B
text: 'Menu leaves a lot to be desire. Not many grain free options

author: Sean Singh
text: 'Loved the atmosphere. The order taker didn‚Äôt tell me when my order was ready which meant my order sat on the counter for a few minutes. The turmeric latte was delicious as turmeric flavored things go. The dosa waffle was just okay. Based on the name I wanted something with a little more flavor. I would return to try more of the menu.'

author: girishc78
text: 'Ginger and masala chai was good
column5: waffle dosa was so so
column6: not great.'

author: Ben and Stef Thornberg

author: sarita shinde
text: 'I had higher expectations from the place. The ginger tea was good but the chai latte and saffron tea were disappointing. The waffle like dish is something called- angry young woman
column5:
which was average. The the other open toast was good.

I would go here again only for the ginger tea and under dire circumstances.

Still look for that amazing cup of strong tea!'

author: Jayrut Patel
text: "They don't prepare indian chai. They buy ready to drink Girnar chai packets and add hot water and flavors. Poor choice of the menu and expensive food for the breakfast."

author: Jordana Jaffe
text: 'Make sure to get to go bc the ‚Äúfor here‚Äù is way too small and not worth the price. Other than that great place!'

author: Vinothini Gunasekaran
text: 'People who miss a perfect Indian style chai should definitely visit this place!'

author: Suganthi prasana
text: 'The ambience is beautiful with an instagram worthy neon light wall! Sadly
column5: that‚Äôs about it though. The ginger chai is good and a must try
column6: The snack and cookies are good! otherwise the Dosa waffles simply miss the mark! A lot of onions on the waffles takes away the flavor! The sandwiches are fine! I wish they improve their waffles (such a diff concept but need that to taste unique too)! Also
column7: they need to include more food items that would go with a hot cup of chai!'

author: Krupa Patel
text: 'Love the place
column5: staff is very friendly and interior remind or authentic Indian environment üëçüëç'

author: Binny Patel
text: 'Great concept

column6: needs more maintenance
column7: and better staff. Took 45 min for my order. Again

author: HD13

column5: a little on the sweeter side
column6: which I don‚Äôt mind.  Size is a little smaller than I would like for the price. Will definitely come back to try more chai options and food selection.'

author: Leslie Sargent
text: 'Great dirty chai and super friendly service!'

author: Punit Shah
text: 'Absolutely loved Hidden Grounds in New Brunswick
column5: was bummed they closed the JC location
column6: but thrilled they opened in Hoboken under this new name. Wish I had known earlier!\n\nRose chai was an OG NB favorite
column7: is gonna be hard not to keep coming back every day on my way to work'

author: Anuja Joshi
text: 'Good place. Chai is amazing. The service can be improved.'

author: Rish Agarwal
text: 'Nice cozy friendly place with delicious variations if Indian traditional hot milk tea (Chai). Good selection of snacks too. Perfect place for a first date. Try their cafe mocha too if you are coffee aficionado.'

author: Vishant Joshi
text: 'Good vegetarian options'

author: Ali Siddiqui
text: 'Overrated tasteless Chai'

author: Gaurav Jindal
text: 'Rose chai recommended. Crowded all the time! Expect delay in service.'

author: Evgeniia Volkova
text: 'Simply Chai is such a special place! You won‚Äôt find these kinds of teas anywhere else - it‚Äôs very authentic and incredibly delicious. Perfect for a cold winter day. I got a cardamom chai and it was pure magic: perfect mix of milk
column5: sweetness and spices.\n\nAlso they located only a block away from Hoboken Train Station. It‚Äôs very convenient to stop there while you are waiting for your train or bus.'

author: Sourabh Bansal
text: 'Ordered coffee
column5: ginger tea
column6: and bombay toast. It has a beautiful decor. The tea was made with patience and hence the underlying milk had a great aroma. However
column7: it was too sweet
column8: was a tiny portion and was not filtered properly. The coffee was great
column9: though it was too small as well. The bombay toast was okay. The place is really overpriced though.'

author: Nirav patel
text: 'Good desi flavors.'

author: Surbhi Agarwal
text: 'This place is so cute and has really good freshly made chai and that‚Äôs why it worth going to! - I wish they would add samosa and toast to the menu- its the ultimate desi breakfast pair- chai and Samosa and chai and toast- I can guarantee this will make them even more attractive!!'

author: Vignesh R
text: 'Rose chai is different class.'

author: lokesh paduchuri
text: 'Wow the perfect place to stop the chai craving. The elachi tea and the masala tea will remind you of home for sure.\n\nI just saw about this place in Instagram and went here over the weekend with some friends. The interior is well decorated and I love the feels of this place and I love the way they serve their chai with the little hearts biscuit that reminds me of my childhood.'

author: shalom
text: 'Chai is good
column5:
wish the cups were bigger and bit less sweet . It‚Äôs definitely unique and different and closer to Indian brewed tea.

The pancake dosa is cool

Masala egg toast is good'

author: Haripriya T
text: 'Good but costly'

author: ruchi mohapatra
text: 'Love this place. I had amazing ginger chai with mouth watering masala egg toast.'

author: Shilpa Jindal
text: 'Stumbled into this place and love it!'

author: khyati vyas
text: 'Interesting concept. I dint really taste the dosa in the waffle but the filling was amazing. All the place is pretty cute. We had the angry man or women something dosa\n\nChai was ok.'

author: Praveena Prasad
text: 'A different experience for Chai drinkers with varieties of tea
column5: both hot&cold served in khullads(mud tea cups). One time visit
column6: but a little on the pricier side. Interesting snack options such as the dosa waffle fusion. Ambience and overall decor feels like home.'

author: Ajay Malik
text: 'Great Ginger Chai. Service with a smile üëå'

author: anshuma jain
text:
'Replying back

It's feels great to know that you take customer's suggestions seriously and very happy to know that on reading my review you even teND to remove chicken soup from menu. Still I see masala egg toast being launched a day ago and there's a point which I had stated before "We support vegan and vegetarian restaurants so still I cannot make it to your place " and believe me you have such an amazing Unique menu that I do not think and neither have read any review nor heard from anyone that your menu must have something non- vegetarian; then why?

I really appreciate the the uniqueness of dosa waffles and had been a huge fan of bombay dreams and burning man. Go vegetarian and earn lifetime loyalty of customers like us.

Thanks!

Reply to owner‚Äôs message

There was one item called chicken noodle soup and other one with egg whose name I do not recall..

And I am surprise you yourself do not know your restaurant is serving non-vegetarian dishesü§îüò≥üò≥

Update after my visit to this place today

I liked the place had been there last Friday and again today... Difference between in these visits was they have raised prices and started serving non-vegetarian meals. My friends had burning women waffle today n they did not like it all...

We support vegan and vegetarian restaurant so it's a good bye to this place.

First review as under:

Wow what fusion food...burst of flavors...simply in love with Bombay Dreams waffle...would definitely suggest every Indian chaat and dosa lover to visit...I'm not a chai lover but my friends loved their teas as well..'

author: Where We Gather Blog
text: 'Food and service are great! Chai will be the best you‚Äôve ever had. Definitely try a waffle and enjoy the ambience!'

author: Vidhi Mehrotra
text: 'Oversweet chai
column5: toasts overloaded with ketchup. Not at all appetising for the eye. I wanted to try the place for its great reviews. But was totally dissappointed!!\nIt could have been or it still can be as the concept is really nice.\nThe ambience and interior decor is good though.'

author: Vivek Narayanan
text:
'Short block away from the Hoboken PATH station.
Beautiful mix of East meets west. I‚Äôve been craving some good chai for such a long time in nyc and so glad to have this place in my own neighborhood - Hoboken.

For those who want to get the authentic chai experience
column5:
try a chai flight which will get you to taste 3 different varieties of chai with Indian biscuits (cookies) that you can dunk in it.

The owners of this place also manage Hidden Grounds - an amazing local coffee shop in hoboken.

The savory waffles are a real treat as well. We‚Äôre pretty sure we‚Äôll be back here whenever we crave a Bombay sandwich'

author: Anat Klein
text: 'Great place to grab a cup of a tasty chai and work with your laptop or eat your lunch. Love the millennial waffle.'

author: Abhinav ‚ÄúAbhi‚Äù Lohia
text: 'Good concept bad execution. We tried this place
column5: it failed to hit the spot big time. We ordered the Bombay Dreams Waffle and the Burning Man waffle
column6: both lacked flavor.'

author: Aiswarya KS
text: "Enjoyed the chai
column5: filter coffee and the Bombay Dreams waffle dosa. I can handle the heat but the burning man waffle  dosa was too spicy and not so enjoyable. But I'll be back to try other waffle dosas."

author: Sheikh Ali Ahmed Faiz
text: 'Overpriced with no sense of tea flavors.'

author: Prashant Mayani
text: 'Food was too spicy'

author: Feba Michael
text: 'Ok this place doesn‚Äôt even fellow the business hours mentioned on the site. I went there at 7:30pm on Sunday and we were told that they are closed when they are supposed to close at 8pm on the weekends.'

author: Karthik G
text: 'Highly recommended.. Authentic Indian Chai'

author: Sudhanshoo Sharda
text: 'Amazing place. Tried their Saffron and Elachi Chai. Was amazing.'

author: Baburao Ghongade
text: 'Amazing place to hangout and for very tasty chai'

author: Kinjal Gala
text: 'Amazing place for a chai lover .. the best thing is that they make fresh chai unlike other places that offer machine one .. and a very new concept of Dosa waffles which tasted delicious ! A place recommended for a must visit'

author: Rashmi Chandrashekar Kamkeri
text: 'Disappointed with so much sugar in the tea and less options available to eat.'

author: David Orr
text: 'I tried a sweet and savory dosa waffles
column5: the one with bananas and chocolate syrup. Delicious
column6: and filling for 7 bucks. Also had an iced coffee with cardamom that went well with the dosa.'

author: Bansari
text: 'The millenial dosa waffle is amazing!!!  Like a healthy savory version of a waffle.'

author: Andrea Gutierrez
text: 'Cutest spot ever!'

author: Shireen Bhullar
text: "(In a nutshell - really good chai
column5: great ambience
column6: **burnt** dosa waffle at first but they replaced it upon complaint)\nA fairly new chai place in Hoboken with an amazing aesthetic and unique menu. Loved the entire decor with the ceiling umbrellas
column7: their story on the side wall
column8: and the faux grass wall in the back. What set them apart from other chai places is that they make chai fresh using the traditional stove method instead of brewing a larger quantity ahead of time. They have three main chais - masala
column9: ginger and cardamom. We tried the ginger and the masala - they both tasted great. We asked for it to be stronger and bolder in taste and they were able to accommodate our preferences.\nThe only **negative** was our food (initially). We were really excited to try the dosa waffle - it is clearly an innovative concept. We realized they were busy and the food might take some time. After 25 minutes of wait
column10: we were presented with a burnt dosa waffle (photos below for reference). We didn't even have to taste it
column11: anyone could look at it and tell that it was burnt. So I took it back and asked for a new one - they were nice about it. They brought out our food in under 5 minutes and we appreciated it. I just hope in the future
column12: they don't serve customers burnt food in the first place.\nAll in all - would recommend! :) Just expect a long wait on weekends."

author: Natasha
text: "It was my first time trying this place. I ordered masala  tea and it definitely didn't taste like masala tea. Taste was so bad almost seem like tea was reheated.  Tea was served in to go cup. Waiting time is very long more than 40 min."

author: Manpreet Mutti
text: "Majorly disappointed. Came here especially for the earthen pot. Horrible customer service. Long waiting hours for no reason. Place wasn't busy at all. When I got my tea served in a go to cup I was given the explanation that the place is closing for the night soon and we are putting those pots in the dishwasher. Why wasn't I made aware of this 30 mins ago when I had made the order. Would not recommend this place to anyone. Place is only Instagram glam without the actual substance behind it. Wish I could give zero for this review"

author: Megan Gillen
text: 'Loved the vibe of this place! Very cute aesthetic with plenty of tables to sit at. I got the Saffron Chai which I‚Äôd recommend. I think the drinks are on the pricier side
column5: so I would go once in a while but would definitely recommend.'

author: Priyank Thakor
text: 'Good tea.  The dosa dishes are good concept but a little heavy on chutney.'

author: SIDDHARTH BHANSALI
text: "Amazing place to spend time alone or with friends....Masala Chai served with 2 little hearts must have - bit overpriced but worth if you are Chai lover....Bombay dream dosaüòãüòã - reminded me of Mumbai grilled sandwich in a dosa.\nGuilty pleasure had chocolate syrup - could have been better with Nutella but overall can't give less than 5 *."

author: Sonia P
text: 'This is such a cute place. The saffron chai is so good!'

author: Michelle Woodruff
text: 'Love this cafe. The Chai is delicious and very authentic. I also recommend the Dosa - absolutely delicious!'

author: Abhishek Jain
text: 'Amazing place with very cute decor. The teas (chai) are very authentic tasting; and the dosa waffles are finger licking good :)'

author: Tj Stanton
text: 'Phenomenal coffee/tea spot. A must visit!!!!'

author: K A
text: 'Initially this place served a great tea
column5: now it looks like they are just reheating the old tea and the place has become little  unhygienic. Tea khullad are chipped from top edge
column6: place have weird smell especially at the tables near restroom and tables do get clean often. Out of three visits only my first visit was great. Sometime they serve tea on table sometime they just call out for pick up. Not going back there!!'

author: Rajil Jain
text: 'Amazing Interiors
column5: great taste.'

author: Sayali Khodke
text: 'A very nice and cozy place.. loved the ambience.. although just got some coffee there their menu and chai options look good too..'

author: Sarat Chandra
text:
"A cute chai based cafe serving good drinks and food with fabulous Indian themed decor.

Detailed Review:
Absolutely loved the Indian themed decor which gives it a hip modern cafe feel. The food and drinks served here were great and it is slightly expensive for drinks but the dosas are reasonably priced. The ambience was great
column5: would definitely recommend the sofa seats with cushions to sit and work a few hours or spend a leisurely afternoon here.\n\nDuring my visit
column6: I had tried their Rose thandaai with Bombay dreams dosa. The rose thandaai was a gently flavored rose drink which was light
column7: delicious and very pleasant to have. It wasn't overwhelmed by sweetness or rose essence and had good balance. The Bombay dreams waffle dosa was great
column8: it packed a punch of flavors with the green mint and date chutneys. The Bombay dreams waffle dosa was a fusion of the classic Bombay sandwich and the savory waffles. FYI
column9: few may find the savory dosas like the Bombay Dreams pretty spicy and be mindful. The portion sizes were great and service was just fab.\n\nBtw
column10: they serve Little Hearts biscuits with Chai. FYI
column11:
Little Hearts is one of the most iconic Indian heart shaped biscuits/snacks from the 90s and is still pretty popular.

Recommendations:
Drinks: Magic Masala Chai (hot)
column12: Rose Thandaai (cold)\nSavory Dosas: Bombay Dreams or Burning Man"

author: Andrew G
text: 'A great addition to the Hidden Grounds empire in a warm and spacious space inherited from Sunnyside Cafe (even the neon sign remains!). Selling dosas as waffles (that is
column5: waffles using dosa batter) is pretty inspired and the result is delicious. I like the simplest one personally ("Mom\'s Favorite"). The chai is very good and unlike in South Asia you don\'t have to worry about an upset stomach :-) .'

author: Shubhangi Rathi
text: 'Cool Ambience! Great for a Saturday/ Sunday Brunch. Love the Chai‚Äôs there !!'

author: Vishal S
text: 'Pure Indian style tea
column5: made really well
column6: served really well
column7: just right combination of water & milk.\n\nFriendly staff
column9: easy parking.\n\nHowever on a little pricy side for a cup of tea.'

author: Karina Colotl
text: 'The rose chai was absolutely amazing. I would totally recommend it and go back here for it. The dosa waffle however was not very good. It was on the harder side and had a strange after taste (personal preference).'

author: Neha.V. Deshmukh
text: "I ordered a saffron thandai and the taste was not authentic at all. The thandai just tasted like matcha iced tea. There was no hint of saffron in it. One of my colleagues had ordered the same thing some other time and the taste was great. The staff didn't do a good job of preparing it."

author: Barbara Lopez
text: 'Really cute restaurant
column5: instagram worthy. I had a traditional chai latte hot
column6: it was good
column7: full of spices. I also tried the dosa waffles
column8: which were interesting. They had small cookies with some types of chai which were delicious. Staff was very friendly.'

author: Christian Casteel
text: 'The chai here is really good. Really really good. The best I‚Äôve ever had
column5: actually. So come here for the chai and make sure you try a dosa waffle while you‚Äôre at it. The Bombay dreams waffle is what dreams are made of.'

author: Christina Colon
text: "Best iced chai latte & iced matcha latte (different name in store) I've had in my life. I was literally lost for words
column5: it was that damn good! Friendly
column6: clean
column7: & really all about the costumer experience. The only thing I can't stand is there hours. It was twice I attempted to purchase some drinks and you guys were closed üòë"

author: Erin Clyne
text: 'Delicious Chai! I tried their magic masala and rose chai today
column5: and they‚Äôre both delicious and different from any other chai I‚Äôve had so far. Highly recommended! Next time I‚Äôll have to try their waffles. This will be a go-to place for me.'

author: MrMrs Casteel
text: 'The best chai you can get in New Jersey! The food here is wonderful as well I highly recommend the Bombay Dreams dosa waffle. The rose and saffron chai are my absolute favorite. Service is wonderful and the space is clean
column5: bright
column6: and lovely!'

author: Lisa Marie Zapata
text: "The space is beautiful
column5: the atmosphere is very chill
column6: and all in all
column7: it's a great teahouse. Can't wait to return. Wish the hours were a bit longer."
